Immunization for children
All children must be immunized with the following vaccines:
✱  BCG against tuberculosis
✱  DTP against diphtheria, tetanus, and whooping cough
59
✱  HepB against hepatitis B
✱  Hib against Haemophilus influenza type B
✱  Measles against measles
✱  OPV against polio
Each country has its own immunization schedule based on WHO guidelines. 
When giving advice on immunization, please refer to the national immunization 
schedule. 
What can happen after being vaccinated?
Just like any other drug, vaccines also can cause some unfavourable effects.  Most 
of these are mild which include fever, pain, swelling and local redness at the site 
of injection.  In situations where these events are serious, it should immediately 
be brought to the notice of the nearest qualified medical practitioner or health worker.
